questions.title: What is the correct syntax for defining a function in JavaScript?

options: myFunction(arg1, arg2);
call myFunction(arg1, arg2);
run myFunction(arg1, arg2);
execute myFunction(arg1, arg2);
questions.title: What is the correct way to call a function in JavaScript?

options: To stop the function from executing
To specify the output of the function
To specify the input of the function
To specify the name of the function
questions.title: What is the purpose of the return statement in a function?

options: An argument that is required for the function to run
An argument that has a predetermined value if no value is provided
An argument that is optional and does not need to be provided
An argument that is used to specify the return value of the function
questions.title: What is a default function argument in JavaScript?

options: The function keyword can be used to define a function inside an expression
The function name can be omitted while creating the function expression
Function expressions in JavaScript are not hoisted
All of the options
questions.title: Which of the followings is true for function expressions in JavaScript?

answers.3: To specify the output of the function
answers.4: An argument that has a predetermined value if no value is provided
